newsitem.title: USA: Intrav to acquire Clipper Cruise Line.
newsitem.headline: Intrav to acquire Clipper Cruise Line.

text.p: Intrav Inc said Wednesday its board approved the acquisition of Clipper Cruise Line.

The company selling Clipper -- which operates two ships, the M/V Yorktown Clipper and the M/V Nantucket Clipper -- is controlled by Intrav's chairman and major stockholder, Barney Ebsworth, Intrav said in a statement.
The stock purchase agreement provides for an initial payment of $10.2 million. Intrav will also repay $5 million of debt held by Clipper operating companies. Both amounts are subject to adjustment.
Intrav may make an additional payment of up to $3 million if Clipper's net cruise revenues exceed $70 million by December 31, 2000, Intrav said.
Clipper's 1996 net cruise revenues from operations are expected to be about $20.2 million, Intrav said.
"We feel the acquisition of Clipper Cruise Line enhances the overall value and earnings potential of Intrav," Larry Nolan, Intrav's president and chief executive officer, said in the statement.
Stifel, Nicolaus & Co of St. Louis issued an opinion as to the fairness to Intrav shareholders.
Intrav said it would finance the deal from current working capital with possible utilization of its revolving credit facility.
The deal is expected to close by December 31, 1996.
